cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the central-south Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas (includes Texas City/Galveston area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible late Friday night through Saturday (sustained 25–35 kt generally south of the port, lower at the port).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in and near Galveston Bay, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 8 inches could fall Saturday into early Sunday, causing localized flash flooding and ponding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along adjacent beaches; reduced visibility in heavy squalls.
